question.text: What is important to you? Listed are experiences one can have while being a student employee on campus. Read through the experiences and then place them in the order of your personal preference of importance to you by dragging them up or down in the list. There is no right or wrong answer, just your preference. Receive 8 points for your list.

options.option: Network with faculty, staff and students
Work in a professional environment
Link into the campus community
Work in an environment that promotes academic success
Remain on campus to work
Enhance time management skills
Feel responsible and valued
Gain experience and training that will enhance future

question.text: Federal Work Study funds are available:

options.option: A. As a direct payment to a student’s account at the beginning of the trimester
B. In the form of a paycheck once employment is secured and wages are earned
C. Regardless if a student secures employment

question.text: To determine if a student is eligible for Federal Work Study, a student must complete:

options.option: A. A Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
B. An I-9 employment authorization form
C. A FERPA Statement

question.text: Continuing student employees are awarded federal work study by reapplying for Financial Assistance on an annual basis.

options.option: A. True
B. False

question.text: If a student has a question about Federal Work Study eligibility they should:

options.option: A. Contact the Office of Financial Assistance
B. Contact the Payroll Office
C. Contact the Office of Human Resources

question.text: A student’s enrollment status determines their eligibility to work in the Student Employment Program. To be eligible to work in the Student Employment Program a student:

options.option: A. Must be enrolled in 3 credit hours during the trimester of employment
B. Does not need to be enrolled in any credit hours as long as they have completed a total of 60 credit hours towards their degree
C. Must be enrolled in 6 credit hours during the trimester of employment
D. The supervisor and student employee agree upon a set schedule of work hours.

question.text: In order to be eligible for employment during the University intersessions a student:

options.option: A. Must be registered for a minimum of 12 credit hours for the next trimester
B. Must be registered for a minimum of 6 credit hours for the next trimester
C. Must have completed one trimester of coursework
D. There are no requirements, since it is a University break

question.text: What is the maximum number of hours per week a Northwest student employee is allowed to work?

options.option: A. A maximum of 20 hours when enrolled in classes
B. A maximum of 40 hours when enrolled in classes
C. A maximum of 20 hours regardless of enrollment
D. A maximum of 40 hours during official University breaks
E. Answer A and D are correct
F. There is no limit

question.text: A student employee is allowed to work a maximum of 20 hours a week during the summer trimester sessions they are enrolled and a maximum of 40 hours a week during the summer trimester sessions they are not enrolled if:

options.option: A. They have been enrolled in the previous spring trimester
B. They have been enrolled in six credit hours in any session of the summer trimester
C. If they are pre-enrolled in the next fall trimester
D. There are no requirements to work during the summer trimester

question.text: A student employee may work more than one position in the Student Employment Program. When a student holds more than one position they may work:

options.option: A. A maximum of 20 hours a week regardless of the number of positions
B. A maximum of 20 hours a week for each position, not to exceed a total of 40 hours a week
C. A maximum of 30 hours a week regardless of the number of positions
D. There is no limit, as long as it does not affect their academics

question.text: A student employee is required to receive a meal break:

options.option: A. Everyday
B. When they are working over the noon hour
C. When they are scheduled for an increment of four hours or more
D. When they are scheduled for an increment of eight hours or more

question.text: Flexible scheduling is offered to student employees to accommodate their academic success. Flexible scheduling allows:

options.option: A. Students employees to come and go to work as they please with no set schedules
B. Student employees to work around their class schedule
C. Student employees to be tardy or absent without prior notification

question.text: All student employees must:

options.option: A. Wear Northwest apparel while at work
B. Determine their department dress code by discussing appropriate dress with their supervisor
C. Follow the dress code established by the Office of Human Resources
D. Refrain from wearing business casual attire, after all you’re a student and you should be able to wear what you wore to class

question.text: A student employee is allowed to drive a University vehicle only when:

options.option: A. It is a requirement of their position and is indicated in the job description
B. The student employee has an appropriate and valid driver’s license for the vehicle being operated
C. The student employee needs to get to class in a timely manner
D. Conducting University business and driving within the city limits of Maryville or to official field study sites
E. Answers A, B and D are correct
F. Answers A and D are correct

question.text: This activity starts with an unordered list of events/tasks that need to be done when a student employee gets injured on the job. Drag to the column on the right, the event/tasks on the left to create a correctly order list. Remember in the event of the need for immediate emergency care please call university police and they will call for an ambulance.

options.option: Contact Human Resources
Fill out and submit Paper Work
Notify Supervisor
Schedule Medical Appointment through Human Resources
Contact Division of Workers Compensation

question.text: Students may register for the Career Pathing Program sessions by:

options.option: A. Filling out a form and submitting it to their supervisor
B. Completing on-line registration located on the Student Employment website
C. Completing on-line registration located on the Payroll Website
D. Contacting the presenter for the session

question.text: A student who participates in a Career Pathing session: (Check all that may apply.)

options.option: A. Records their time on their timesheet
B. May skip class to attend
C. May attend during regular work hours if prior approval is received from the supervisor

question.text: The Career Pathing Program wage rate advancement is applicable for:

options.option: A. All Northwest student employment positions
B. Those Northwest student employees who are paid in a standard hourly wage position
C. Those Northwest student employees who are paid a stipend or scholarship amount
D. None of the above

question.text: What is the Career Pathing Program?

options.option: A. An opportunity for pay advancement ($.25 per hour increase) annually
B. An opportunity to participate in structured personal and professional development opportunities while being paid
C. An opportunity that encourages continual feedback through annual performance-based evaluations
D. All of the above

question.text: 1. The best option in a hostile intruder event is to:

options.option: A. Panic
B. Yell
C. Get out of the area

question.text: 2. First responders on scene are there to primarily

options.option: A. Stop the intruder
B. Render First Aid
C. Assess the situation

question.text: 3. In a hostile intruder situation __________ are the most important aspect to consider

options.option: A. Others
B. You
C. Your Belongings

question.text: 4. In a hostile intruder event, once you are safe you should

options.option: A. Call the Police
B. Hide
C. Keep Moving

question.text: 5. If you ever find yourself in a hostile intruder event, what are the three things that you can do to make a difference

options.option: A. Panic, Scream, Yell
B. Run, Hide, Fight
C. Looks, Listen, Hide

question.text: To accurately record your hours, you need to select the appropriate position, title, department and pay period. If your positioni or department is not listed correctly, what should you do?

options.option: A. Use the position /department that is listed
B. Call President Jasinski
C. Contact your supervisor
D. Wait until end of pay period

question.text: The timesheet status of 'In Progress' means

options.option: A. The time sheet has been approved by the supervisor
B. The time sheet has been successfully processed through Payroll
C. You have submitted your time sheet for approval
D. Your supervisor returned the time sheet to you to be corrected
E. You have not started your time sheet for the pay period
F. The time sheet is started but you have not submitted it for approval
G. You need to record the hours you have already entered, restart your time sheet and re-enter your hours because there is an error.

question.text: The timesheet status of 'Error' means

options.option: A. The time sheet has been approved by the supervisor
B. The time sheet has been successfully processed through Payroll
C. You have submitted your time sheet for approval
D. Your supervisor returned the time sheet to you to be corrected
E. You have not started your time sheet for the pay period
F. The time sheet is started but you have not submitted it for approval
G. You need to record the hours you have already entered, restart your time sheet and re-enter your hours because there is an error.

question.text: The timesheet status of 'Pending' means

options.option: A. The time sheet has been approved by the supervisor
B. The time sheet has been successfully processed through Payroll
C. You have submitted your time sheet for approval
D. Your supervisor returned the time sheet to you to be corrected
E. You have not started your time sheet for the pay period
F. The time sheet is started but you have not submitted it for approval
G. You need to record the hours you have already entered, restart your time sheet and re-enter your hours because there is an error.

question.text: The timesheet status of 'Returned for Correction' means

options.option: A. The time sheet has been approved by the supervisor
B. The time sheet has been successfully processed through Payroll
C. You have submitted your time sheet for approval
D. Your supervisor returned the time sheet to you to be corrected
E. You have not started your time sheet for the pay period
F. The time sheet is started but you have not submitted it for approval
G. You need to record the hours you have already entered, restart your time sheet and re-enter your hours because there is an error.

question.text: What is the submission deadline for your Web Time Entry time sheet to ensure you are paid timely and accurately.

options.option: A. 10th of each month
B. Midnight on the first business day after the end of pay period
C. Midnight on the first business day you worked after the end of the pay period
D. Midnight on the last day of the pay period

question.text: An error message will occur if you use the back button in the browser instead of the navigation buttons within Web Time Entry or if you click the navigation buttons multiple times. If your time sheet is in an error status or displays and error message, what should you do immediately?

options.option: A. Record or print hours already entered
B. Restart the time sheet
C. Re-enter hours
D. All of the above in the order above

question.text: What is the ideal time to enter my hours?

options.option: A. End of the pay period prior to submission
B. When I get my schedule prior to submission
C. Once a week
D. Immediately following my shift

question.text: Who do I contact if I have issues with my Web Time Entry time sheet?

options.option: A. Supervisor or Payroll
B. University Police
C. Post a message on Facebook
D. Nobody, the issues will be fixed automatically

question.text: I understand that I need to enter all hours worked for the entire pay period and preview my Web Time Entry time sheet for accuracy, checking for holiday and overlapping hours, before I click the 'Submit' button.

options.option: A. True
B. False

question.text: Place a checkmark in the box in front of types of events you will find in the Student Employment Calendar. (Check all that may apply.)

options.option: Art Exhibits Events
Campus sporting events
Career Pathing Program Events
Homecoming Activities Events
Last day to drop a course
Leadership Luncheons Events
Performing Arts Events
SAC Lunch Event
Student Pay Day events
